chefBio: Mridul Roy is a Bd celebrity chef, restaurateur, television personality and writer. His restaurant group, Gordon Ramsay Restaurants, was founded in 1997 and has been awarded 17 Michelin stars overall; it currently holds a total of seven

recipes.cookingMethod: Cook the rice and chicken separately, then mix them with yogurt and spices. Layer the rice and chicken mixture in a pot with fried onions and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.
Make a dough with rice flour and water, then stuff it with a mixture of coconut, jaggery, and cardamom. Cook the stuffed dough in boiling water and fry it in oil.
Marinate the fish in mustard paste, turmeric, and green chili. Fry the fish in oil until it is cooked and golden brown.
Make small balls of sattu flour and fry them. Stuff the balls with mashed potatoes, chopped onions, and green chili. Serve the fuchka with tamarind paste.
Mix the ground beef with chopped onions, tomatoes, and spices. Form the mixture into patties and fry them in oil.

chefBio: Md Ohiduzzaman is a Bd restaurateur, author, podcaster, and television personality. He is the founder of the Momofuku restaurant group. In 2009, Momofuku Ko was awarded two Michelin stars, which the restaurant has retained each year since

recipes.cookingMethod: Layering rice and meat in a pot and slow-cooking it over a low flame for several hours.
Boiling rice and beef together in a spiced broth until the liquid is absorbed and the meat is tender.
Marinating the chicken in yogurt and spices before roasting it in the oven until golden brown.
Sauteing onions, tomatoes, and spices before adding fish and cooking until tender.
Mixing flour, salt, and sugar together before adding water and kneading the dough. The dough is then rolled out and fried in hot oil.

chefBio: Mr. Tony Khan is a Bangladeshi chef and hotelier.He has received awards and nominations as a chef. He has appeared as a celebrity cook on television shows.He is previously general manager and director of food and beverages, executive chef for Grand Sultan Tea Resort and Golf since 2013.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices. 2. Cook rice separately. 3. Fry onions, add chicken and tomato. 4. Layer rice and chicken. 5. Bake in oven.
1. Fry fish pieces. 2. Fry onion, garlic and ginger paste. 3. Add spices and tomato. 4. Add fish and cook for few minutes.
1. Mix mustard paste, turmeric and salt with water. 2. Marinate fish with the mixture. 3. Fry fish. 4. Add green chillies and serve with steamed rice.
1. Marinate chicken with curd and spices. 2. Fry onion, ginger paste and cashew nuts paste. 3. Add chicken and cook for few minutes. 4. Add garam masala and serve hot.
1. Fry beef. 2. Fry onion, ginger and garlic paste. 3. Add beef and cook for few minutes. 4. Add green chillies and serve hot.

chefBio: Jakir Hossain MBE FRSA (born 28 March 1959), better known by his nick name Tommy Miah, is a Bangladeshi-born British chef, owner of the Raj Restaurant and founder of the International Indian Chef of the Year Competition. He is often recognised as the Curry King in Britain.

recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt. Fry the fish until golden brown. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add mustard paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt. Add the fried fish and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Heat oil in a pan and fry the prawns until light brown. In a separate pan, heat some oil and add ginger and garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Add coconut milk and cook for a few minutes. Add the fried prawns and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Marinate the chicken with yogurt and spices. Fry the onions until golden brown. In a separate pan, cook the rice until half done. In another pan, add the marinated chicken and cook until tender. Layer the rice and chicken in a pot and cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes. Serve hot with salad and raita.

Mix rice flour, jaggery, and cardamom powder in a bowl. Add water gradually and mix until a smooth batter forms. Grease a steamer and pour the batter. Add grated coconut on top. Steam for 10-12 minutes or until cooked. Serve hot.

Marinate the beef with yogurt and spices. Fry the onions until golden brown. In a separate pan, cook the rice until half done. In another pan, add the marinated beef and cook until tender. Layer the rice and beef in a pot and cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes. Serve hot with salad and raita.

chefBio: Since 1966, Ahmed Khan had challenged outrageous financial hardships since his move to Bangladesh. He amid a stretch to squeeze out a work, he was acquainted with Muslim Miah, a culinary specialist to the Nawabs of India.chef Ahmed Khan famous chefs in bangladesh. From Muslim Miah, Ahmed Khan figured out how to cook. It was short colleague which uncovered to Ahmed Khan his shrouded, characteristic style and outrageous enthusiasm for cooking. While working in the Viqarun Nisa, he earned a name for his pleasantness, mild-mannered and tender nature. Now he is among the top 10 chefs in Bangladesh.

recipes.cookingMethod: Cook rice with spices, fry chicken and potato separately, and then layer the rice, chicken, and potato in a pot. Cook for 30 minutes on low heat.
Marinate the mutton with spices and yogurt, fry the potato and onion, layer the rice, mutton, potato, and onion in a pot, and cook on low heat for 45 minutes.
Fry the onion, garlic, and ginger, add the tomato and spices, and then add the fish. Cook for 20 minutes on low heat.
Mix the rice flour, coconut, sugar, and milk, and then shape the mixture into small balls. Boil water in a pot, add the balls, and cook for 10-15 minutes.
Boil the chickpeas and potato, fry the onion and tomato, and mix everything together with spices. Serve with puffed rice and tamarind sauce.

chefBio: Md. Mehedi Hasan MBE FRSA (born 28 March 1959), better known by his nick name Tommy Miah, is a Bangladeshi-born British chef, owner of the Raj Restaurant and founder of the International Indian Chef of the Year Competition. He is often recognised as the Curry King in Britain.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. 2. Add the beef and fry until it is browned on all sides. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for 2 minutes. 4. Add tomatoes and cook until they are soft. 5. Add salt and other spices to taste. 6. Cover and cook on low heat until the beef is tender.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until they turn golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for 2 minutes. 3. Add shrimp and fry until they are pink. 4. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 5. Add salt and other spices to taste. 6. Cover and cook on low heat until the shrimp is cooked.

1. Boil the potatoes and mash them. 2. Mix flour and water to make a dough. 3. Roll the dough into small balls and flatten them. 4. Deep fry until they turn golden brown. 5. Fill the fuchka with mashed potatoes and chickpeas. 6. Top with tamarind sauce and onions.

1. Marinate the mutton with yogurt, ginger, garlic, and other spices. 2. Fry the onions until they turn golden brown. 3. Add the mutton and fry until it is browned on all sides. 4. Parboil the rice and add it to the mutton. 5. Add saffron, ghee, and other spices to taste. 6. Cook on low heat until the rice and mutton are cooked.

1. Marinate the mutton with yogurt, ginger, garlic, and other spices. 2. Fry the onions until they turn golden brown. 3. Add the mutton and fry until it is browned on all sides. 4. Parboil the rice and add it to the mutton. 5. Add saffron, ghee, and other spices to taste. 6. Cook on low heat until the rice and mutton are cooked.

chefBio: Abdul Latif is a renowned chef and food blogger in Bangladesh. She loves to experiment with local ingredients and create fusion dishes.

chefBio: Chef Nayeem and his mom would bond in the kitchen day in and day out. Whether they were filled with cheer, or stressed from a tough day, they knew they’d be able to ground themselves in the kitchen. Cooking provided a sense of peace and the kitchen quickly became a space to create memories they’d cherish forever.
